On Sep 4, 2008, at 1:50 PM, Berend de Boer wrote:

>>>>>> "Subbu" == Subbu Allamaraju <subbu@...> writes:
>
>    Subbu> Regarding standardization, I presume, that the reviewers  
> were
>    Subbu> looking for a standard like SOAP and the WS-stack. The right
>    Subbu> way to analyze is:
>
> Well, what is standard with SOAP? The cruft around the message.  
> Useless,
> no one knows what it means, you just put it around your message and  
> call
> it SOAP. But the inside of the message isn't standardised
> either. Meaning is still in the description. Moreover, we have no
> preconditions, so the order of calls has to be gotten from the
> documentation as well.

Of course.

Subbu
